alert.note: Alert for Coos (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 8:47PM PST until January 15 at 8:42AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting Coos County. South Fork Coquille River at Myrtle Point affecting Coos County. For the Coquille River...including Coquille...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...South Fork Coquille River at Myrtle Point. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, The South Fork Coquille River is at flood stage. Expect flooding of roads west of the Spruce Street Bridge and significant pasture and agricultural land flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:20 PM PST Sunday the stage was 33.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 35.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:20 PM PST Sunday was 35.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this evening to 19.5 feet late Tuesday evening. It will then rise to 24.3 feet early Thursday morning. It will fall to 17.7 feet late Saturday morning. It will then rise to 27.7 feet Tuesday, January 23. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 33.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 33.0 feet on 12/18/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 845 AM PST.
